DataElement.preferredName: Patient Serious Eating Disorder Present Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to whether the patient has a serious eating disorder.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Causing fear or anxiety by threatening great harm; of great consequence._A broad group of psychological disorders with abnormal eating behaviors leading to physiological effects from overeating or insufficient food intake._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Causing fear or anxiety by threatening great harm; of great consequence.:A broad group of psychological disorders with abnormal eating behaviors leading to physiological effects from overeating or insufficient food intake.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Causing fear or anxiety by threatening great harm; of great consequence.
A broad group of psychological disorders with abnormal eating behaviors leading to physiological effects from overeating or insufficient food intake.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/6/2020: CM Released as part of draft content review

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a serious eating disorder such as bulimia or anorexia?
